outboundEndPoints.description: A list of outbound endpoints to propagate data throughout the scope of the flow. Note thatonly flow scoped variables are supported.

boundAs.description: This attribute allows to bind one pmd tag to more than one Outbound Endpoint. See child tag outboundDataURI 'secondaryFor' attribute for detail.

values.description: This is the place you can define a list of parameter objects used for this outgoing Endpoint

outboundPath.description: Attribute for variable name. Based on the scope of the variable, it can be set as flow variable or session variable for subsequent use.

exclude.description: Attribute for exclude condition. If this attribute evaluates true, the variable will be set, otherwise it will be ignored.

value.description: Attribute for variable value whose name is specified in outboundPath attribute. It is binding object, so you can specify binding here.

name.description: Name is used as the reference for this outgoing Endpoint during binding.

variableScope.description: Attribute used to define the variable scope. Its value comes from enumeration set {session, flow}. Session value means the scoped variable can be referenced in pmd within user session, while flow value means the scoped variable can only be referenced in pmd within the flow definition.

flowBlob.description: An attribute that represents the flow model encoded as a string.

flowSteps.description: The steps that make up the flow.

taskBindingName.description: The task name associated with this flow step.

configurableModel.description: Defines the configurations on this flowStep in terms of which properties will allow logic to be used.See 'configurables' for more information.

attributes.description: List of the names of attributes on the corresponding tag that customers can set the value for.

allowLogic.description: When set to true, customers will be able to use binding values (when appropriate) on attributes they have control over.

name.description: The name of the flow step.

id.description: The id of the flow step. This id is used by the flow itself to denote the initial stepor within flow step definitions to denote which step should follow after a user clicks next.

skipStep.description: A binding that helps determine whether or not this step in the flow should be skipped.

condition.description: This binding determines whether or not a tranisition to the step defined for the valueproperty will be executed.

value.description: This property denotes the id of the task or flow step that will come next after the usersuccessfully submits on the current flow step.

taskId.description: The task id associated with this flow step.

exitUri.description: If set, flow will redirect to this URI after submit

id.description: The id used to denote this flow. This id is used to link a task orchestration tag to a flow. It can also be used in a route to navigate to a flow.

initialStepId.description: This field is used to determine the first step of the flow. This id should correspond toan id of one of the flow steps in this flow. If this property is omitted, then the initial step will be resolvedto the first flow step defined for this flow.

flowParameters.description: A parameter that could be moved out to its own metadata in the future; the flowParametersallow the flow creator to specify the the filters underlying the flow for configuration.

iconId.description: Id for icons that are built in to UIC for display with instance

preview.description: Binding to determine if the user has access to view a preview of the instance's detailswithout needing to navigate to the instance. Note VPS does not support preview, this attribute is meant for sites that support SSO where a preview request can be answered by UI Server

view.description: Determines whether or not the user has access to view the instance's details.  If true, the instance's text becomes a link.  If false, it remains plain text.

relatedTask.description: Binding to determine if related task icon is to be displayed. Note VPS does not support related tasks.This attribute is meant for sites that support SSO where related task requests can be answered by UI Server

action.description: Action describes how the client should treat the instance when displayed as a link/button. Examples are Home, Attachment, PRIMARY. Actions strings are case sensitive.

id.description: A binding that uniquely identifies the instance - instance's identifier

descriptor.description: A binding that that describes the instances. Used as instance's display value

target.description: Url for the instance - To be replaced with taskTag soon

endPoints.description: A list of endpoints to be used to retrieve data.

deferred.description:
When set to true, this endpoint will not be called at the time of rendering the page.
Primarily used with the 'Fetch Data' widget for retrieving data based on selections made by the user on the page.

headers.description: HTTP headers that are added to requests to this endpoint.'

preprocessed.description:
Do not set to 'true' unless you discuss your use case with a VPS developer.
When true, data retrieved will not be treated as JSON.

isCollection.description:
When set to true, requests look at the size of the incoming data and retrieves the entirety of it through multiple requests.
For use with endpoints potentially retrieving large sets of data (>100 entries).

url.description: A binding for the URL address of this endpoint: where the data will come from or be sent to.

baseUrlType.description:
WARNING: MAY BE DEPRECATED IN THE FUTURE.
A String that designates the application this endpoint is being used for, and thereby the structure of the complete URL for this endpoint.

path.description: The path to a resource under a Workday service. This is used to create the fully qualifiedurl for Workday services in conjunction with the service identifier property.

external.description: When set to true, authorization schemes and accept-language are not set in the header of the request to the endpoint. Used for requests outside of Workday.

bestEffort.description: When true, no error will be thrown when one normally would be. Instead, a JSON message will be received with an error message as a field.

search.description:
Should be set to 'true' on an endpoint used for 'Faceted Search'.
When 'true', the endpoint will attach query parameters to the URL necessary for 'Faceted Search' to function.

service.description: An ID that maps this endpoint to a REST service.

name.description:
A String used for referencing this endpoint in the page builder.
Access data in the response from this endpoint with the syntax 'name.labelOfDataToBePulled'.

useUserAuthWhenAvailable.description: When true, requests to this endpoint will use the userSession's 'AuthType' (if it isavailable) rather than the default (if a use 'AuthType' is available).

cacheable.description:
When set to true, data retrieved from this endpoint will be cached for future requests.
NOTE: Only set to true if data from this endpoint won't be updated frequently. Data from this endpoint may get stale since there is currently no way to cache invalidate.

exclude.description:
When set to true, no attempts to call this endpoint will be made.
Set to true when the URL for this endpoint could be invalid (Example: 'url': '${someData}' and 'someData' may be empty).

id.description: A Workday ID that maps to an endpoint object in expresso

authType.description:
The 'AuthType' you are using to authenticate requests to this endpoint.
For example, if SSO or USERAUTH, you are authenticating the request as the logged in user.
Most other 'AuthTypes' are system level authentication.
Different 'AuthType's can be used on different endpoints on the same page.

toggleEndPoint.description: The endpoint used to retrieve application toggles.

responseDataKey.description: Override the key in the api response to access the data. The default is "data"

deferred.description:
When set to true, this endpoint will not be called at the time of rendering the page.
Primarily used with the 'Fetch Data' widget for retrieving data based on selections made by the user on the page.

headers.description: HTTP headers that are added to requests to this endpoint.'

requestChunkParameterName.description: Override the name of the query parameter for setting chunk size. The default is "limit"

preprocessed.description:
Do not set to 'true' unless you discuss your use case with a VPS developer.
When true, data retrieved will not be treated as JSON.

requestOffsetParameterName.description: Override the name of the offset query parameter for setting the offset. The default is "offset"

isCollection.description:
When set to true, requests look at the size of the incoming data and retrieves the entirety of it through multiple requests.
For use with endpoints potentially retrieving large sets of data (>100 entries).

responseTotalKey.description: Override the key in the api response to access the total count. The default is "total"

url.description: A binding for the URL address of this endpoint: where the data will come from or be sent to.

WARNING: MAY BE DEPRECATED IN THE FUTURE.

requestChunkSize.description: Specify the request chunk size. Chunk size defaults to 100 if none is specified. Can not be specified if URL already contains the query parameter.

seed.description: The contents of the pod. This should contain a hierarchy of tags that can be constructed in place of the pod tag.

template.description: A generic container that should be filled with a tag that will be processed in place of the pod tag.

automationId.description: AutomationId is solely used for automating the UI elements. The automationId present on the DOMwill be a transformation from this automationId. If this value is not present, id will instead be used togenerate the automationId

configurableModel.description: Defines the configurations on this pmdTag in terms of which properties will allow logic to be used.See 'configurables' for more information.

alias.description: Alias acts as the 'pretty' name for the tag in contrast to the id. Currently this attributedoes not perform any functions with regards to the logic/rendering in the pmd. In the future this shouldbe referenceable in a similar fashion to the id

label.description: Label is the text that is present either to the side or above for most widgets. If a widgetis a non-simple widget this property is not guaranteed to be respected. Basic widgets include inputs suchas Text and Date. A widget such as the top-layer Grid however will not display a label.

render.description: Render determines whether or not this tag will be turned into a widget. If thisproperty is empty the widget will always be rendered. If true, then the widget will also be rendered. If falsethis tag, and all children tags, will not be rendered. This is different from @visible in that references tothis tag/widget will not be stored in the case that this is false.

parameters.description: A list of parameter keys that defines what parameters are needed to populate values within the @template.

rawSeed.description: Same as @seed but the JSON is encoded into a string and will be deserialized upon reading the PMD.

podId.description: The unique ID of the pod that is referenced by Pod tags to insert the pod into a specific place within the presentation.
